'''Pyroar''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''カエンジシ''' ''Kaenjishi'') is a dual-type {{2t|Fire|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Litleo}} starting at [[level]] 35.

==Biology==
Pyroar is a quadruped, leonine Pokémon. It is mostly dark brown with light brown legs, tail tip, chest, and face. A male Pyroar has a large, dominantly red mane with gold streaks forming pattern resembling the ''Daimonji'' symbol 大. The shape also resembles the symbol for fire 火. In contrast, a female has a long, gold and red mane extending from its forehead to the whole length of its body. Pyroar's irises are tinted [[wp:Azure_(color)|azure]] with black pupils.

Pyroar live in prides, led by the male with the largest mane of fire, and the females protect the pride's {{p|Litleo|cubs}}. Male Pyroar are usually lazy, but will protect its friends at the risk of its own well-being. Pyroar viciously threatens any challenger with a fiery breath exceeding {{tt|10,000 degrees Fahrenheit|6,000 degrees Celsius}}. It prefers to eat its meat raw.

====Major appearances====
=====[[Lysandre's Pyroar]]=====
A male Pyroar debuted in ''[[SS031|Mega Evolution Special II]]'', under the ownership of [[Lysandre]]. It reappeared in ''[[SS032|Mega Evolution Special III]]''.

Lysandre's Pyroar made its main series debut in ''[[XY094|From A to Z!]]''.

=====Other=====
Four Pyroar appeared in ''[[XY097|A Fiery Rite of Passage!]]'', with three of them being female and one being male. The male Pyroar forced a Litleo to leave their pride to become more independent, but kept an eye on it. It eventually allowed Litleo back into the pride.

A female Pyroar appeared in ''[[XY137|Battling With a Clean Slate!]]'', under the ownership of [[Alvin]]. It battled against [[Clembot]], who used {{TP|Clemont|Magneton}}, and lost.

====Minor appearances====
A male Pyroar debuted in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]'', under the ownership of [[Astrid]].

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Pyroar and its {{p|Litleo|pre-evolution}}.
* No other Pokémon has the same [[List of Pokémon by gender ratio|gender ratio]] — [[:Category:Pokémon with a gender ratio of one male to seven females|one male to seven females]] — as Pyroar and {{p|Litleo|its pre-evolution.}}
* Pyroar is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 507.
* Pyroar shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Slowking}}. They are both known as the Royal Pokémon.
* Though the male Pyroar has a chevron-shaped nose in its official artwork and in [[Pokémon Battle Trozei]], all other merchandise, game, and anime artwork shows it with a triangular shaped nose, similar to that of the female.

===Origin===
Pyroar is based on a lion. The style of its fur, in particular the spiked areas on its limbs and tail, more than likely is a reference to {{wp|Lion (heraldry)|stylized lions in heraldry and coat of arms}}. The yellow pattern on the mane of a male Pyroar is similar in shape to the ''Daimonji'', a bonfire lit during the Japanese festival {{wp|Gozan no Okuribi}} in the shape of the symbol 大 (meaning ''great'' or ''large''). The shape also resembles the kanji for fire (火), as written in certain (often calligraphic) styles. Its [[:Category:Pokémon with a gender ratio of one male to seven females|gender ratio]] also resembles lions prides, which consist of one primary male lion, several females, and one or two lesser males.

====Name origin====
Pyroar may be a combination of ''[[wiktionary:pyr-|pyr-]]'' and ''roar''.

Kaenjishi is a combination of 火炎 ''kaen'' (flame) and 獅子 ''shishi'' (lion).
